name: Introduction to Political History
description: This course provides an introduction to the field of political history, including its major themes and the roles of various actors throughout history.

name: World History I & II
description: This course covers the history of the world from ancient times to the present day, with emphasis on major political, social, and cultural developments.

name: American History I & II
description: This course covers the history of the United States from the pre-Columbian era to the present day, with emphasis on major political, social, and cultural developments.

name: European History I & II
description: This course covers the history of Europe from antiquity to the present day, with emphasis on major political, social, and cultural developments.

name: Comparative Politics
description: This course examines the political systems of various countries and regions, including their historical development, political structures, and policies.

name: Political Theory
description: This course covers the major theories and thinkers in the field of political science, including their historical development and contemporary applications.

name: Political Ideologies
description: This course examines the major ideologies of the modern world, including their historical development, major proponents, and contemporary applications.

name: Political Systems
description: This course covers the major systems of government, including their historical development and contemporary applications.

name: Political History
description: This course focuses on the history of politics, with an emphasis on the major political, social, and cultural developments throughout history.
